document_data.caption: A map showing the location of Paektu-san.
document_data.name: Paektu-san
document_data.mainbody: '''Paektu-san''' was a settlement in the kingdom of [[Koryo]] in [[Kara-Tur]].<ref group="note">Nothing is known about Paektu-san itself. Like many sites in Koryo, Paektu-san shares a name with a real-world counterpart: [[Wikipedia:Paektu Mountain|Paektu (or Baekdu) Mountain]] in North Korea, where "-san" means "mountain". However, in Koryo, Paektu-san is denoted on maps as a settlement, not a mountain, and lies on the coast, away from the mountains.
document_data.Geography: Paektu-san lay on the southern coast of the western peninsula, north of the [[Dragon's Teeth]], a series of straits that were impossible to navigate.
